thread.title: Taxi drivers urged Jefferson Parish to block the Uber app
thread.title_full: Taxi drivers urged Jefferson Parish to block the Uber app - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Sabrina Wilson
title: Taxi drivers urged Jefferson Parish to block the Uber app
text:
KENNER, LA (WVUE) - Taxi drivers protested outside a hall in north Kenner Wednesday where the Jefferson Parish Council was meeting.
They are keeping the pressure on as they object to Uber X drivers operating at Louis Armstrong International Airport and other parts of the Jefferson Parish without approval, or without having to follow the same rules that cabbies face.
"To drive a cab we have to have a chauffeur's license, for hire license plate, occupational license and Uber is working without any of these regulations,” said Niran Gunasekara, of AFSCME Local 234 which represents local cabdrivers.
Inside the council meeting venue, the taxi drivers lined up to voice their frustrations.
"We're asking you to have mercy and if Uber wants to come in let them be governed like we are, new cars, insurance, drug testing, everything that we have to do,” said Addy Washington, who has been driving cabs for almost four decades.
“Ask City of Kenner and Jefferson Parish to stick with the right regulations which enforce the right procedures…no matter who they are,” said Cabbie Luay Mohamadieh.
Others suggested the parish eventually banish Uber to outlying areas.
 "We cannot run 60 miles down to Grand Isle, let's put Uber down there in the marshes, where they can serve and they can be respected on that area,” said Herman Woods, also a taxi driver.
Council members listened intently.
"You can't put people at a disadvantage and expect one group to adhere to rules and regulations that another one doesn't,” said Council Chair Chris Roberts.
Parish Attorney Deborah Foshee said Uber has not been very cooperative when approached about the existing regulations.
"Unfortunately our attempt to bring them to the table for those rules is when they walked off, so at this point we have no option, we can no longer wait for them to come to us, we're going to have to cause them some pain,” said Foshee.
A parish lawyer was in court Wednesday morning seeking a temporary restraining order against Uber. And recently the parish even sued some Uber drivers, this after months ago issuing a cease and desist letter to Uber.
"Seeking to have Uber .. the individual drivers named to stop performing services in Jefferson Parish,” Foshee stated.
And the parish attorney thinks it is time that the state attorney general gets involved as it relates to the rules for Uber.
"Let the attorney general weigh in on whether or not statewide transportation networks such as Uber are required to have cars with commercial drivers' licenses, and 'for hire' plates and the other regulations,” said Foshee.
Cabdrivers demanded that the parish block the Uber app from working in Jefferson.
"I'm requesting the parish officials to shut the Uber app until they get some regulations,” said Gunesakara.
But Foshee stated that it would take a court order to make that happen.
Copyright 2015 WVUE .
